O5wBdZE4fnRBC432t8RBxg.text: Hawksmoor has ruined eating out for me forever. Nowhere else matches up. Make a regular pilgrimage from Manchester for the amazing T-bone, the perfect chips, that amazing lobster mac & cheese, the dreamy creamed spinach... Not the mention fantastic, original cocktails and perfect desserts. Air Street is my favourite. Beautiful. Love love love it. Perfection.

QPlUGbYnEOGZETjbCa-s7g.text: I haven't met a steakhouse in London that's as good as the Hawksmoor. This location is just as good as the Seven Dials location, and possibly better as it feels like you're high up (in reality only one floor up from the ground floor) compared to in a windowless dungeon somewhere.The steak... wow. Our medium rare chateaubriand was unbelievable. Melt in your mouth tender, perfectly seasoned, and bathed in peppercorn sauce. It makes my mouth water just thinking about it again... throw in some greens (broccoli and cream spinach) and a potato dish - I wish I could remember what it was called - something like "Jonsson's Temptation", which was potatoes, cheese and anchovies made for an incredible (and very filling) meal. To top it off we shared a sticky toffee pudding, which I still believe is the best in London.It won't be a cheap evening, in fact, it'll probably be one of your more expensive dinners in London. But if there's a special occasion, and you need a steak, look no further than the Hawksmoor.

JfqhnEoxvRBFagGQTH6Ncw.text: During our honeymoon to London, we went to Hawksmoor specifically for its Sunday roast (it was on every reviewer list I found for London's best Sunday roasts), and we were not disappointed. This was probably the nicest restaurant (ambiance-wise) that we went to, but by no means the most expensive. We both ordered the roast, which came with a large serving of beautifully cooked meat, roasted potatoes, Yorkshire pudding (so good!), carrots, greens and bone marrow & onion gravy for £20 each. I had a delicious cocktail (the Grapefruit Picador) and we shared the macaroni and cheese, which was some damn good mac 'n' cheese. We didn't have any complaints about the service, and the restaurant was large and comfortable. Nice bonus: It's just around the corner from Piccadilly Circus tube station.

QUsXhk3kAG1AZ95QP-YjOA.text: Going here as a vegetarian, I wasn't expecting the world when it came to their Sunday Lunch - after all, Hawksmoor is known predominantly for it's meat menus.   However the staff are great and more than happy to accommodate and find substitutes for those of us less meaty inclined. Each venue specializes in different fares, so one would be steak, another fish etc... I'm not sure which Air street is, but they had a brilliant selection of meals to choose from, and the decor is lovely. The wine list is extensive and well priced, so expect to wander out well fed and a little wobbly on your feet!

LO7QIGSu0eQvVT8pT68flg.text: We had a very good experience at Hawksmoor.  Upon our arrival we were treated warmly by the host staff, and we were escorted upstairs to the bar for cocktails. We were quite tickled by the great specialty drinks menu filled with great classic libations, some of which are Hawksmoor versions; we wanted to try every drink on the menu. The overall look and feel of the restaurant is like a large speakeasy. I ordered the Sunday Roast ( roast beef, Yorkshire pudding, roasted duck fat potatoes and carrots etc..), needless to say, it was delicious and the service was very good. I really like this place!

NPm7NovfcEPwD8QcwWHWJA.text: I never knew this place was there. It doesn't advertise itself very much. Hidden at the quirky end of Air Street it only shows one simple door with nearly invisible writing. Stepping into it I felt like I'm in a set for a film noir. I wish I would wear a lovely satin frock, had my hair done and bright red lipstick. Sadly I had done none of that. Sigh. A cocktail will help me over my disappointment about myself. The menu is extensive and we tried many different ones and they were all delicious. this hidden Art Deco cave is the right place to drink away a gloomy Saturday afternoon.the restaurant is much brighter as it has nearly every surface covered in stylish mirror tiles. Real film noir stars don't eat and we didn't either.

imU59FdMyFKBA_ckMnLEwQ.text: Best cocktails, best steak in England let alone London, and really great service to boot!My boyfriend surprised me with a birthday dinner here, and now we also have the cookbook.. The recipes are SO intricate that it makes me appreciate the Hawksmoor staff even more. We'll definitely be back.

bsMk4ZULuIMZc71pqVoOIg.text: It started a little slow.  We order the rib eye and lobster Mac and cheese - to die for.  Our waitress was the best our meat was not cooked as order and she was so apologetic that she ordered a new cut and took care of our drinks.  The meat was great. Excellent cut and flavor. Barbara thank you for the great service and beautiful smile.

HQVf7MWf9EsSaa9xIF6wbQ.text: AMAZING. I can't say more than that. Been here twice and have never been disappointed, my absolute favourite steakhouse in London. Yes it's expensive, but it's worth it.

6mrG_YHLU4_kNdyUKxOskA.text: Went there last week, had the scallops to start which were great. Followed by a 950gr porterhouse stake to share, with the triple fried chips and buttered greens.Everything was really good, service was great, steak was well cooked and of good quality!Only negative of the evening, the Béarnaise sauce was pretty bad, i would be ready to bet it came straight out of a jar, which is not acceptable in this kind of restaurant.I ended up not eating it, considering how good the steak was it was probably for the best.The deserts were good, but nothing spectacular.It is on the expensive side, but you do get a nice steak.

Yh6dnEQ28LcHUCX2h26Heg.text: Go on Sunday.  Get the Sunday roast.  Add a side of roasted bone marrow.  Grub.  Insanely delicious.

FV-yK11OoK7-cI2p9vvfVg.text: Went out for Sunday lunch and I really couldn't fault it. We had superb,  friendly and attentive service throughout; made to feel very welcome. The steaks were fantastic, obviously of high quality meat and cooked perfectly. The accompanying sides were delicious and I strongly recommend the anchovy hollandaise sauce.There was an good wine list as well as a cocktail bar. The setting is art deco and there is a relaxed feel, but I'm sure it would be suitable for an occasion.

uZjuT85s0mfLjjHvEMoR7g.text: I've struggled to write a review of Hawskmoor Air Street and by now it's long overdue. Because - How do you describe your soul mate?I'll explain.We started to go to Hawksmoor Air Street when we couldn't get into the Covent Garden branch. So, yes, this started out as poor planning. But I like to think of it as destiny.The interior feels like an episode of Poirot and has loads of space and (perhaps to the detriment of the management) you really could sit there all night. Since I like to think that I'm as artsy and sophisticated as an episode of Poirot this works quite well for me.Then we move on to the bevies. I had to take a moment to look fondly/wistfully into the sky as I typed this. The bevies are uh-mazing. They're original enough so that you won't find another quite like the one you're having anywhere else if you choose from the cocktail menu but if you go off the menu they're very adept - I had a great rendition of an aviation.I'll move on to the soul mate part. We had already had a visit from the manager thanking us for coming (!), we had indulged in gorgeous starters, and I was tucking into a lovely morsel of filet when my husband said, "You're singing."And I was. See, they were playing the Artic Monkeys and without thinking about it, I was singing along.So, I get a great cocktail and heaven-sent steak AND I get to listen to one of my favourite bands of all time while I enjoy this?Soul mate.

5Zs72tal18LMxz1hOFnsBw.text: My wife and I found Hawksmoor on Yelp when we were looking for somewhere to eat before going to a show.  Add other people have mentioned the decor is really neat.  Think Roaring 20's and art deco.  We were stayed quickly.  The appetizer of salmon was incredible. Both the steak and fish we ordered was cooked perfectly and tasted incredible.  Dessert want too shabby either!  The service was great and well paced.  Outstanding!

IE9OXZHtn-KSyEbxCf_w3Q.text: I have been a massive fan of Hawksmoor for a number of years but have come to the sad realisation that it will never live up to my first visit - it was perfection.My first visit to the Air St branch started well. Our waiter was a pure delight throughout the whole night and our cocktail to start hit the spot.For a restaurant that is all about steaks...well...it was disappointing. My table ordered both rare and medium - both cuts were cooked unevenly which was a shame at £30 a pop. The sides of triple fried chips and creamed spinach were excellent.The highlight of the night was the salted caramel tart. We shared a serve between two which was plenty given how rich it was (and the big main). I still really enjoyed it but might only go for their express menu from now on which is available before 6.30pm at a discounted price.

f9lp06lvreQ_AnmwR7slAA.text: We had a great experience here for lunch.  We were famished after having done a lot of walking around and needed a satisfying meal on a cold day.  I was pleased to make a reservation at short notice for 4pm, as so many other places are closed at this time.  It is in a very convenient location, near Piccadilly Station, so it makes sense that it has extended opening hours to cater to the visitors to the area.We were craving a satisfying steak meal and that is what we got.  We both ordered a rib-eye steak and triple cooked chips.  We also had extras of bone marrow, fried eggs and a fennel/watercress salad.  My wife prefers her steak to be on the rare side and she was pleased with how it came out.  I like mine done medium and I was also happy with my steak.We chose a very nice bottle of Malbec and this complemented the meal well.  I enjoyed this lazy Saturday lunch.  Heaven is a slice of steak with a dollop of tasty bone marrow on top.  What a delicious mouthful!  The triple-cooked chips provided the crunch and the fennel/watercress salad provided some acidity to cut through the intense flavour.  Halfway through, I had one of the fried eggs and ate some chips with the runny yolk.  Again, delicious.Honestly, it would have been sensible to stop there.  But I had to have something sweet to round off the experience.  We browsed the list of puddings and every one of them sounded great!  I ended up getting the salted caramel rolos - probably as a nod to how full I was feeling at the time.  But, I could have been convinced to go for the chocolate and salted caramel tart with popcorn icecream.  The salted caramel was delicious and partnered the dark chocolate shell well.  There were three of them and I let the last one melt on my tongue to have the dark chocolate and salted caramel flavours combine.Excellent service.  We were acknowledged immediately when we arrived and when we walked up the stairs we were welcomed and shown to our table.  We were attended by a number of different servers throughout the meal, but it was seamless.  We never felt that we were waiting long for anything.I fully recommend people to try this restaurant for a good steak meal and an overall satisfying experience.

inquO1tbKo2NTD6e8pc0Lw.text: LONDON Steakhouse? Yep! One of the best!! In London? I KNOW. Food was cooked exactly how we wanted, like my meat red, and it came just that...  service was wonderful. Great date spot or get together with the family or friends. We went in a group of 6, and even the vegetarians enjoyed. a bit pricey but for what you get its definitely well worth it! Not to mention the drinks were very good!

BkFEqU8BCxBSH8iBCFvzeg.text: Okay I will start of with stating that this a review of the steak triple fried chips and beef dripping potatoes. Not the service which was great. Long story short if you are used to American beef then the stuff you get in the UK  is not a fraction as good as the stuff from the USA so if your an expat looking for steak or burgers those are two things the Brits do very badly don't even bother looking. You find outstanding Indian and Chinese joints but meat is not their strong point. Sorry hawksmoor service was great food not worth the cash.

GQ-9Dhy-oFKl8fCWoK2F-w.text: I landed here for a celebration dinner from work - we have these after every project. We were 5 blokes (read as 5 proper carnivores). I was only one who hadn't been here before and the leader of our pack, a steak aficionado and wine connoisseur did all the ordering. A kilo each of porterhouse, t-bone and bone in prime rib later we were more than convinced we had enough meat. Starters of crab on toast, potted beef (easily the best) and grilled bone marrow kept us going till the meat arrived and boy were we spoilt! Bone marrow sauce was a new find for me and I must say peppercorn, mushroom and blue cheese better watch out! Wine selection was very very good and so were the deserts that followed. Deserts were interesting twists on traditional fare like stick toffee pudding and cheesecake but they didn't do anything to take attention away from the star of the nigh which was the beef we chomped down! As if we hadn't done enough there was a bit of Cognac that went around and for a bit of left field choice for a pallet cleanser it went down very well. Staff were always very friendly and attentive and kept things very casual in what can easily be modeled as a fine dining establishment with waiters wearing tailcoats and bow ties, the faded jeans and t-shirts helped to a certain extent in keep our evening casual and relaxed!

nsQ5WYwpCBcSW5SRKWFDcA.text: I wasn't totally sold on this outlet of Hawksmoor.  I am a huge fan of the Spitalfields location which has personality.  This one seemed chain-y and impersonal and is so overwhelmingly massive.Our cocktails took forever to come out.  20 minutes--come on!  We also had to hail down the waitress a few times to get service.  I'd expect more for the exorbitant prices.Let's talk about those exorbitant prices--bream for 40 quid?  Holy mackerel!  And then adding on sides--the bill adds up so fast.It felt like an expense-account place and I was hoping for more.  I'll continue to support their great steak but probably on the east side....

YnZVdSM2CDwP3q9aM3lUyw.text: Really fantastic place. Best steakhouse in London for sure.I did the express menu which is available before 6:30 for £27 plus £3 extra for sauce. I had the bacon and meat pot with Yorkshire puddings for starter, and it was delicious. Meaty and perfect flavour. It was so huge however, who two giant Yorkers, that it would have been better to share. For main, I went with the 300g rump, medium and it was perfect. Probably the best rump I've ever had. Flavourful tender beef, perfectly medium. But the killer was the bearnaise, which was just the best I've ever had. I had some left after finishing the steak and ate it with a spoon. For wide I had the lettuce and herb salad, which was also a huge portion, and perfect for the beef. I was going to have chips but after the starter l knew I would explode so had the salad and it was dressed with an amazing dressing. I couldn't decide on dessert, as was basically stuffed,  but went with the shortbread peanut butter cake as I do have a huge sweet tooth, and it was also delicious. Simply delicious.Oh, and service was just perfect. Super friendly and just efficient and happy.I don't eat steak often as I'm virtually a vegetarian and it's REAllY hard to get good meat when eating out (that's why I don't), but this was just awesome.

ND1Dy0yChEjXTQFKXz-I2Q.text: Such a sublime restaurant that works on all levels.I've been to several Hawksmoors but I think this is the best mainly down to both the service as well as the food.We were early for a group dining, and as we sat down to have drinks near the bar the waiting staff put some reserved signs down around us so that our guests could be easily seated.I love the dining room. It's long, and low ceilinged, but manages to be both clubby, and personal at the same time. A very british version of an american steakhouse.The fish here is as amazing as the steak, and if you're eating a duex I'd really recommend having one of each so you can share. The hawksmoor cut of turbot, for instance.Let the staff guide you on food, and wine, you'll be well taken care of.

i4Y_5DCNKqgMGO78wMQYBw.text: It most certainly lives up to the reputation.  Our steaks were cooked to perfection, the sides equally tasty, and if there was anything we needed or any questions, it was met with exceptional service; the staff clearly knew the menu well. It was the right amount of attendance as well. We leisurely ate our dinner and never felt rushed or hassled. I don't think I really need to say  anymore as the reviews and rating kinda speak for itself. The Sunday lunch keeps popping up on reviews which I will most certainly be trying out.

IRXKQarx6BgDstEDsVV-_A.text: An absolute fan and will be returning very soon!This restaurant oozes classiness, it's warm, elegant yet comfortable and inviting. Warmly welcomed by a waitress, we sat down and looked at the menu. For starters, I had the shrimps on toast which was a small plate but just enough as the main meal was so large. It was a garlicky, buttery, parsley goodness. My friend ordered the potted beef and bacon which was basically two massive Yorkshire puddings with warm potted beef and caramelised onions. It was tasty but that's all I could say about it. There was not really any uniqueness about the starter dish. I also decided to start of with a Kir Royale which ended up being far more expensive than it should've been in my personal opinion. But man o man, I do love a Kir Royale!We asked what was recommended and the waitress suggested the 'd-rump steak' as it had many flavours and good texture. All of us ordered it on the table, and we were not disappointed. This piece of meat was so juicy, so wonderfully cooked and utterly moorish. Side dishes did not come with the steak so we ordered chips and buttered Hispi cabbage (which for something so bland as a cabbage, was so tasty).Anyway, this piece of steak was bigger than my face, but I ate it slowly as the atmosphere of the restaurant does not make you feel rushed whatsoever. They have a gorgeous wine list which I didn't have the pleasure to experience but next time, I most certainly will. Finally for pudding, I had the peanut butter shortbread which was like nectar to insects. It was salty, it was sweet, it was cold, it was warm. Perfect. My palette was doing cartwheels. All in all, the end result was higher than I expected. The servers were very easy going, helpful and left us to eat without any interruptions (which I prefer). Yes, the price isn't cheap but it's definitely affordable if you want something special.

pAzTYObmEROcKmlA90CQKQ.text: I really enjoyed my meal here. I started with the steak tartare that was served up with a perfectly cooked yolk. The yolk brought richness that complimented the steak and capers. For my main I had the chateaubriand which paired well with the bernaise sauce.  I also added a side of bone marrow, which was so tasty. For dessert I had the sticky toffee pudding, which was the perfect end to the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Steak tartare
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. bone marrow with chateaubriand

sQUrQHL5a7-axPHtnSu9mQ.text: First I just have to say I'm obsessed with their decor! Sexy Art Decoish Mad Men is what I think of! Food is good! Had the fish & chips and steak with sides.  The chips are amazeballs! They use pan drippings! Def will return my next trip to London!

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips!

LkrCsqupId9RDJrP4k9dbQ.text: Very good ribeye, though overpriced at 31£ without accompaniment. Had a revolving cast of waiters in no rush, despite my stating I had theatre tickets. The meat was good, though better deals can be had in town.

97-fO3FJ66GjyheL2ZBGeg.text: Rather than buy presents for my friends and family's birthdays, i like to take them to places or go somewhere unusual so that we can share an experience. it was recently my mum's 51st and i wanted to take her somewhere nice in London where the two of us could have a chat and some good food so i decided to take her along to the hawksmoor for lunch.i ordered the roasted bone marrow with onions and toast to start. it was deliciously indulgent and the sweet onions balanced perfectly with the gelatinous marrow - absolute perfection on a plate!or the main course, i opted for the 250g rib-eye steak - ordered rare, perfectly cooked.  we also ordered an array of sides including sweet potato, triple cooked chips, buttered greens and bearnaise sauce to share.  Finally we ordered a sticky toffee pudding to share for dessert. i can't begin to describe how good it was - or how i full i was - but it was all worth it!i highly recommend the express lunch menu at the hawksmoor - it is incredible value at only £26 for three courses and the food really is as delicious as it looks! Our total bill came to just under £90 and included three courses, a glass of prosecco each and service charge

kMhlp5X7JWUVkChzMFq84w.text: I took my nephew there for his birthday and we had a great experience. The services were definitely top notch. I told the restaurant about the occasion and as soon as we walked in, the person at the front desk said happy birthday to my nephew. They sent him a complimentary milkshake which made the young man really happy. They wrote "Happy Birthday" on his dessert plate and put a candle on it. The food was very good. I had the Rib-eye, because I always favor well marbled meat. However, when the steak came, it looked slightly burned on the outside, and it wasn't as juicy as I would like it to be, but it was a very good steak. I have to mention the dessert we shared, because it was super delicious! The honeycomb cheese cake was not your usual NY style cheese cake. It was a decomposed dessert: the rich and creamy cheese mousse was on the outside and the cookie crumble was top. I saw a lot of people enjoying their Sunday Roast which was a huge pile of food for only 19 pound.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom

MPqu3mW3dSPwAHtjG0cVuQ.text: Cannot even begin to describe how AMAZING my entire meal was. It is but a faded memory now as I went some time ago, but I DO remember how stellar everything was. From the drinks, appetizers, to the actual main courses, to the desserts!! The service was impeccable as well. I honestly think my meal here was one of the best meals I have ever had in my life. What I ordered was a pimms cup, the fried queenies, the smoked salmon appetizer. All so so good. Only wish they would have given more of the little bread pieces with the salmon. Entree was the Sunday roast. Out of this world. My partner ordered some kind of white fish with a side of fries and holy moly his food was amazing as well! The ketchup served with the fries is so good! His fish was excellent! After dinner drink of Irish whisky was fantastic and the fricking desserts!!! It was our anniversary so they gave us complimentary little chocolate caramels. We also orders the peanut butter shortbread dessert as well as the sticky toffee pudding with clotted cream ice cream. The shortbread dessert was good, but the sticky toffee pudding was the best I have EVER had in my life. I dream about it. I dream about this entire meal!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom

bMJH95cuSaD0WM6tjXaZxQ.text: This place has it all! Amazing food, alcohol and staff! I read a few amazing reviews on this place and decided to try it... You know, when you read reviews in advance... You almost always set yourself up for disaster... In this case it was the complete opposite! I completely agree with all the 5* reviews. Restaurant was almost full when we were seated... So take that into account when reading my review - they did amazing! We started with two cute cocktail drinks (Marmalade cocktail and the Corpse Reviver). I personally like orange-ish-lemony with a lot of tang... So the Marmalade cocktail fit me perfectly! Next our appetizers... My friend ordered the Half Dartmouth Lobster and I ordered the Roast Scallops. The lobster was incredible! (as we're my Scallops)... But my oh my... Amazing! Cooked just right, and melt in your mouth. Dinner... Starting off with wine (a Shiraz and Malbec) we ordered the 300g Filet, and my friend ordered the 400 Rib-eye. Do I even need to say it.. Cooked to perfection! We ordered medium rare, and that was exactly what we got. So much flavor in every bite. The sides we ordered were buttered greens, chips (so good!!), mashed potatoes, and bone marrow... Oh! And macaroni and cheese (not the best, but good as a side in moderation). The only downside of my dinner was I ordered the wrong sauce to go with my filet... I ordered the bearnaise sauce (as recommended by the waitress) and was not impressed... It sort of tasted like a mix of mayonnaise and hollandaise sauce (and is super thick, like chunky...) . Luckily my girlfriend had ordered the peppercorn (better than bearnaise) but tasted like watered down gravy and not peppery. Next! Dessert!! My favorite :)I got a little too excited and ordered the Lemon Meringue (I thought it said lemon meringue pie Lol so I was a little bit disappointed when my dessert came) but it still tasted good (not great). My girlfriend ordered the sticky toffee pudding.. It was a bit too sweet for me but had good texture. We also got the chocolate / caramel tart pastry (way too sweet for me as well). The ice cream (salted toffee or caramel or something was amazing though!!!) Overall, great experience. Our server was amazing and attentive. Drinks and food were wonderful. Keep doing what you're doing Hawksmoor!

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Marmalade cocktail

eYxejP7ann8Z4BMRuxx95A.text: This Hawksmoor will remind you of a Great Gastby feel. I've been here twice: Once for NYE, and the other was taking the other half's parents. Both occassions the food and the staff have been amazing. The drinks are lush and the food is declious. It is a bit pricey so I would recommend it for a special occasion.Their Steaks are the best in town. I'm not a red meat person but even I was amazed of how good it was.

kKzdzDwHC0fXlJuD4qOoTQ.text: Fantastic food, outstanding service and great location! Try the cornflake milkshake!!! It is soooooo deliciousssss!

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Yummmmm!
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Probably the best Primer rib I've ever had!
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Cornflake Milkshake! Delightful!

SmB2gj38tyUvI5BGcrhTzA.text: I was running late to join my friends, but even as I arrived in a state of fluster I was still impressed to be greeted by the hostess who knew who I was meeting, have my coat taken, and wished a pleasant evening. Instantly I felt like I was in an establishment that was,  if not exclusive, respectful of the people who knew of it and chose to walk through the doors.I found my group and sat as the waiter brought their drinks. We had already decided we were here for a particular cocktail, so I ordered it and a coffee too. The coffee came first- nice flavour, not scorched and a good drinking temperature. (black Americano)The cocktail came next. It was why we there: the full fat butter-infused bourbon old fashioned. Oh. My. That first sip is a thing of beauty. Buttery caramel tones with bourbon based warmth over ice. It is not a complex flavour. It doesn't need breaking down any further in my book. It's the kind of thing you take a sip of and say 'ohmigod'... Just yum.Our (rather attractive) waiter brought over a small plate with the salted caramel rolos they make there; which I was excited about as I'd heard about them whilest reader reviews from other yelpers. Again; yum!We only stayed for two rounds as we were going to to other things, but I will definitely be back to further explore the cocktails and sample the food. The service was great, the knowledge of the staff thorough, and the place itself is beautiful and full of art deco details.It would make a great date too, for those wondering!

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Full fat butter-infused bourbon old fashioned. Delish.

GDtPXNWvrVro0aGJauv8BA.text: I have to say it would be pretty hard to put on a better show than Hawksmoor Air St pulled off last night. Thanks to the gracious Linzi M, I met up with 5 fellow Yelpers to partake in a meat feast of legen-wait for it. Well luckily you won't have to wait too long because I've decided to rewrite this as a summary (the fully review is just over 6 pages otherwise...).HawkAir is located, as one might expect, on Air Street. But be warned, it's not the bit of Air St that Google Maps will show you, no it turns out Air St continues on across Regent St for a few feet. That being said, I located the place based on the mouth watering smell of seared steak so it's not that hard to find.Upon entry, a gracious hostess or two will take your name and yet another lovely lady materialised to lighten the burden of jackets and bags our group had accumulated. As we were 1.5 hours early, we climbed up to the bar to settle in and have a drink. Oh the drinks! I'd been dreaming about some of the new additions to the menu and in particular the full-fat old fashioned. Now the name may need a bit of work but the drink certainly doesn't. It's an Old Fashioned built on a butter-infused bourbon that's blended in house. It smells like fresh buttered popcorn and goes down an absolute treat. It's so good that you can ignore the image of your arteries clogging up while you enjoy each decadent buttery smooth sip. My follow ups of a Stolen Heart (made with two alcohols that have had run ins with the law) and a Bottle of Manhattan were just as delicious - my compliments to the bartender!Right, what do you do when you want to try several starters on the menu and you've shown up with a bunch of foodies. Yep, that's right, you order it all. And that's more or less what we did. I could describe each in detail but the highlights were the Potted Beef & Bacon with Yorkshires (packed fully of dense meaty flavour), the belly ribs (with the most tender meat and tastiest sauce I've ever had on ribs), and the pear and blue cheese salad (sweet crunchy pear + sharp blue cheese = awesome).Okay, I've dithered enough - it's time to talk steak. As a disclaimer, I will say that I rarely enjoy a steak at a fine dining place. I tend to believe that I'd rather spend the money on a quality piece of meat which I can grill myself. But I'll tip my hat to Hawksmoor, they do know how to handle their meat. My T-bone was lightly seasoned with pepper and more heavily with salt to give it that perfect crust. Despite it being over an inch thick and larger than my head around, it was almost uniformly medium rare (the edges were more medium but I'll forgive them that slight transgression). The flavour of the beef came through in spades and I was glad to have opted for the waitress's recommendation of medium rare as opposed to my standard rare or blue. I dove straight into the steak, pausing only occasionally to snap up a chip (the triple cooked chips rival Heston's! Get them even if it's the only side you do!) for a bit of variety. At first I was a bit concerned I wouldn't' be able to finish but each succulent bite pushed me a little higher into meat heaven. The juices spilled over my teeth and down my gullet and left me craving even more carnivorous joy. Peter S had graciously offered to help me finish it but after 10 minutes I was chewing the bone clean having powered through almost a kilo of meat. It's that good.For dessert, the sticky toffee pudding remains one fo the best I've ever had the pleasure of eating. The peanut butter shortbread is rich and buttery and explodes with the taste of fresh crushed peanuts. Special mention should also be made of the Jaffa Cake which is an intense chocolate cake with an orange gel centre. Uber tasty - thanks for the recommendation Tristan J!Finally, I'd just like to say a special thank you to our waitress who dealt with our many questions and requests with a smile and a bit of banter. No matter what, she was always happy to help and well deserving of a generous tip and our thanks.

Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Massive meat feast

X2p8NdfzQQYeN5NtU5F91w.text: I visited last night (Friday) with my sister, her husband and my boyfriend for my sister's 30th. I had been really looking forward to it as I am a serious foodie, had heard great things about Hawksmoor and it's my sister's favourite restaurant. The restaurant itself is nice - cool art deco - and we enjoyed drinks in the bar. I don't drink much alcohol so having seedlip as an option was a nice touch. However, I tried my family's cocktails and they were nowhere near as good as the likes of Hakkasan, despite being in the same price range.The food was all fairly nice, but utterly lacked the wow factor I was expecting. The real disappointment though was that the waiters mixed up mine and my partners fillet steaks - me ending up with a bland medium and him my rare, which he probably disliked as much as I did mine. At the beginning of the meal I swapped some of mine for my sisters chateaubriand and commented that hers seemed more rare than mine but she reassured me that it was just that the fillet was not quite as tender and I was reluctant to make a fuss and complain. It was only towards the end when I noticed my partners steak that he had left looked more red that I realised the mix up. I did mention it then (for these prices that's not a mistake they should make) to simply be told by the waitress that she was sorry and have her walk off! She came back some time later and started clearing, saying no more about it. Later someone did come over and offer to take the two fillets off the bill - a good gesture, but the damage was done and I really struggled to hide my disappointment! The service generally was poor too - the waitress was inattentive, did not tidy our table between starter and main, we lacked water at times and her manner simply wasn't particularly professional. The waiters looked quite sloppy too - again, not what I'd expect. As I mentioned, even without these big issues, the food generally was not exceptional. The sides for the steak, of which we had many, lacked much flavour. The lobster was good and the rare steak was pretty nice, desserts were okay, but it didn't have that something extra to justify the high prices. In fact, the only wow for me was a salted caramel rolo I tried which came as a four with a candle for my sister's birthday. Having eaten in some truly exceptional restaurants, I was expecting so much more. For anyone wondering about going here I would say don't bother - seek out a good Michelin restaurant as it'll be the same price and infinitely better food. It's not even that Hawksmoor's food was 'safe', it simply wasn't that good! It's interesting that other reviewers have said standards are slipping here - I suspect that is the problem and now it's riding on its reputation.

6t0jIiX-rtY1q4Vd1My04A.text: It's absolutely style over substance. For a steak restaurant to be this bad at cooking steak is a crime. And what's worse is that people walk anyway believing that's how steak should be cooked. Back when I was a young man growing up in New Zealand we used to grill up huge numbers of rump steak on the BBQ. About two hours after dinner and several bottles of wine later, we'd start to dig into any left over steak, which by this time had become chewing, cold and sweaty. And this is pretty much what we could served at Hawksmoor. Nice dining room though and the bar is a good spot for a drink. Save your money and try Flat Iron instead. Better steak at a fraction of the price.

GjC145FQ3_gH_H647L-IeQ.text: Excellent experience,very warm friendly staff and the steaks are sublime.the peppercorn sauce is very well seasoned for my taste hence you will not need the table salt provided that was the only fault I could find but it will depend on your own preference so all in all will 100% be dining there again.Its not cheap but what you get is pure QUALITY!!.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Our Surprise dessert we didn't order and was on the house.Excellent professional staff
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Steaks Are Awesome!!

UVbzjtAXM7xnwyqgn6gY4A.text: Just the best restaurant in London. I've visited all the other Hawksmoors but this is my favourite because of the fantastic selection of seafood and it's slightly lighter due to it being above ground. An expensive feast, but worth every single penny. The porterhouse was obviously fantastic but even the sides were comparably brilliant (creamed spinach, beef dripping chips and monstrously large onion rings). Best hospitality, best cocktails, best food in London. Drooling just thinking about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Medium rare 800g porterhouse

8eevYqih2mFH5a97onBJgQ.text: I'm a huge sucker for anything Gatsby themed... that being said you almost feel transported to the time era when you go to Hawksmoor Air Street. Wow. Everything from the stained glass art deco windows to the comfty tub seats, wood, and mirrors. It's a Gatsby girl's dream.Oh, and the food! I have to say I was a bit disappointed that they didn't have fresh oysters. I had looked on another of their menus (South Ken I believe) which had about six different types and Air Street only had fried (sigh). I should have checked the menu! Either way, the ambiance made up for lack of the half shelled lovelies.I got the steak tartare and my husband got scallops (why do they still put the coral bit on scallops we wonder? It's not tasty). My Tartare should have been called 'spicy' tartare as anyone with a low spice threshold may be caught unaware. But I LOVE spice so it was a welcome treat. It also was a generous portion.I had to go lobster for my main.... 800g of it. WHY NOT? As I dived into my lobster with no inhibition, by husband feasted on a 500g bone-in sirloin steak (a lot like a New York Strip). He didn't even get any of the mouth watering sauces or butters because the steak was that good. As an American, I'm a little sad they don't prepare the prime rib like they do in the states - so we didn't order it. The anchovy dauphinois (Jansson's temptation) was rich and wonderful.YES we made space for dessert. My husband went liquid pudding and got an amazing perfectly sized Irish Coffee. I got the sticky toffee pudding with clotted cream which again...heaven. I should not have paired it with port though (way to much date/prune undertones, next time I will also get a coffee!!). To top it off, it was my husband's birthday and they brought out their signature 'rolos' with a candle at the end which was just the icing on the birthday dinner.Perfect for a date, birthday or cocktails. Really, anything fun!

IYveKEyk576iTXcCQpaNBQ.text: The food was excellent as was the service. Generally you order your main and sides separately. The steaks by weights are literally posted on a chalkboard. Once the steaks in that weight class are gone they erase the row. Some of the cuts were pretty large. My wife and her friend split one. The cocktails were decent and they have reasonable wine list. Thought that the rib-eye and heritage tomato salad were good.They have a downstairs bar that is a perfect place to hangout if you are waiting for your table.

quk6ohaWj4sCve3FDVxaHw.text: I love Hawksmoor. Brilliant atmosphere, fantastic service and the best steak in town. Only downside is the £££ paid for experience. But certainly worth a visit for a special occasion.

-Oj1wpbM0w8BhgGp9dP3pw.text: I was expecting the roast at Hawksmoor to be good, and it definitely didn't disappoint!The meat was cooked perfectly, the roast potatoes were nice & crunch and I could have eaten the gravy with a straw. Completely and utterly delicious. It's a great cheaper option on the menu if you're there on a Sunday,  it meant we could also get dessert and an extra cocktail without blowing the bank. The service and atmosphere were lovely as always, and I will definitely be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Delicious roast

Dv4pq7QfAh-JoGzWQGXJkw.text: I have done Breakfast, Sunday lunch and now finally Steak at Hawksmoor. It was one of the last 'famous' steak restaurants to tick off my list and was going up against some of my favourites such as Goodman, Gaucho and Mash...The layout is fantastic, and you feel like you have really escaped the madness of Piccadilly Circus just below you. I love going with a big table as it gives you the chance to try a bit of everything. I kicked things off with the Scallop starter, which was really good-Better than expected, full of flavour and served in their shells which was a nice touch. I also managed to grab a taste of the Pork belly starter and the Yorkshire pudding starter. The Belly was amazing, and will probably on par with the Scallops. The Yorkshire pudding, was just that really...nice, but you can do better on this menu!The main event was always going to be the fillet for me, and at 300g as standard it's a great size. This is what I base a lot of my rating for a steak restaurant on, as that's what I'm here for. It was great, but it wasn't as good as Goodman's or Gaucho n my opinion. I would put it joint 3rd with Mash. The sides are also a crucial part of any lunch for me, and Hawksmoor nailed it here. Superb Mac n Cheese, great Chips and amazing creamed Spinach. Put everything above together and add in some lovely cocktails and this certainly one of my favourite meals and restaurants. It can't get 5 stars because it just wasn't a 5* steak but it's not far off overall.Hawksmoor has a few restaurants, and this is for me its most' upperclass'. Bring the parents, not the party. But do bring someone as it's well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Scallop Starter
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Fillet Medium Rare
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Mac n Cheese

SqvvGdMj5WucKsW3_VTR3g.text: Love the vibe, love the food. Steaks are always perfectly cooked and that cheese hollandaise sauce is yum. I get:The rump - medium well- butterflied - with stilchton hollondaise - a side of buttered spinach - English lettuce - and sometimes, chips! Staff always friendly. No complaints and I come here often.

poZNWc-xAO5amJVMIZrYKw.text: Walked in late in the evening (around 9) for a chance at their Sunday roast and boy it did not disappoint! Good portion and incredibly tasty. Had a glass of bubbly champagne and a tom collins and both were delicious. The sticky toffee pudding was also AMAZING. We will definitely be back for more!

pBQ9kLRGMC-Y187vbG3aYw.text: Love, love, love. Ever since my first visit to Seven Dials maybe 7 or 8 years ago, Hawksmoor never disappoints. Headed for a late lunch/early dinner with my bro before heading to Wembley to see Coldplay. Opted for the shrimps on toast (changing from my usual potted beef and bacon) followed by the Sunday Roast.You know the Sunday Roast will be special when it has its own part on the menu just headed "ROAST" and for £20 this is perhaps the best you'll find in Central London. Perfectly cooked beef, roast potatoes, a giant Yorkshire pud, cabbage and carrots were delicious.The meal was rounded off with some salted caramel rolos and a "post-prandial" as they call them. The cocktails and beers make it pricey (but worth it!) but you could easily do Sunday lunch for two for £60 and that's including a great red wine.Finally, I have to mention the service It never disappoints. Friendly and knowledgeable staff and nothing is ever too much trouble.

2sHdLBb02pjfeHb0Ep-Lyw.text: A very lively place with an excellent menu and while not inexpensive a good value for the money. We both had fish since we had plans for steak a couple nights later and both dishes were excellent. The service was very good and the pace of the meal was perfect. At age 60 I think we were 30 years older than the average of those sitting around us and all seemed to be having a great time.

yJUxTi866jDUzNFHF5zqFA.text: After having been to the top 35 steak houses in Chicago as well as great ones in New York, Seattle and Las Vegas as well as some decent ones in San Francisco I was not expecting to be impressed with Hawksmoor.  Overall, steak is just something done particularly well (no pun intended) in the US.  Hawksmoor blew me away.  It would have been in the top 5 in Chicago, which is a huge compliment, and earned 5 stars there.I started with steak tartare, as it was going to be a red meat evening and nothing redder.  It was easily the best steak tartare I ever had.  Sometimes a bland dish, it had a ton of flavor and was quite complex.As a main, I shared a 1KG porterhouse.  It was cooked perfectly.  Not at all over-cooked (maybe a little rare for medium rare but tasted perfect).  Chips were excellent, as was creamed spinach.The other highlight was a maple bacon side.  It was melt in your mouth with incredible flavor.  Fantastic.Finished with a chocolate sea salt tart which I really did not need, had more than enough food and desserts are just not as exciting as steak to me.

6j6zlcsKCa1K-nk1jPPMIw.text: For all its hype and supposed mantle of being the best place for steak, I was rather bemused at how underwhelming I found Hawksmoor. In fairness I only have people to blame for the expectation and not the restaurant itself as word-of-mouth was that this place was THE place for steak but upon entering you can see that the staff are down-to-earth and unassuming despite these legendary claims. In fact the sincere and diligent service was far more memorable than most of the food itself. Having said that, I'm not sure I agree with the lack of uniformity in dress code of their staff as their clothing is so casual with no defining similarity that any prankster could probably start picking up plates and bills if they wanted to. So eccentric are the staff that our waiter limps due to a skateboarding accident, cracks jokes at every opportunity and describes the food with endearing enthusiasm, meanwhile we are told that the waiter for the table next to us tore his tendons in two fingers by pulling back a chair too vigorously while on the job. Thus, I'm not sure I've ever seen such exuberance from restaurant staff before. On the whole the food and drink was less remarkable but I shall endeavour to share whatever thoughts they did stir up. First off I ordered a Comte Papa cocktail which fell into the trap as many cocktails do of describing all sorts of ingredients to excite your senses on the menu and yet not delivering in the glass; ultimately the drink was anticlimatic and plain. I then ordered the Cornflake Shake which was pleasant enough with a delicately smooth milk (not too thick), a gentle cornflake taste (without too much added sugar) and a few flakes of cornflake on top. Now for the meal: for someone ordering for themselves you are restricted in what types of steak you can choose from as for some impractical reason you cannot order small portions of T-Bone, Bone-In Prime Rib, Porterhouse or Chateaubriand. Not that I mind terribly what steak I get but being restricted by the size of the portion seems unnecessarily unfair. In any case I selected a rib-eye steak medium-to-well-done. I was thereafter served with what could only be described as a well-done steak which to me seemed a little tough and overly salty - certainly nothing to rave about. I had the peppercorn sauce which I was grateful for simply because it served as a welcome masking of flavour to the salty but otherwise lacking in flavour steak. I also ordered the Grilled Bone Marrow for novelty value as I have not eaten bone marrow before and it proved to be suprisingly tender and retains a not unpleasant smoky flavour. Much to everyone's suprise I also ordered another main: half a lobster - from which the lobster meat was permissable but not as good or as hearty as the one from Burger and Lobster and yet I found the garlic sauce that accompanied it to be more pleasant than in B&L as it was less dense and not overpowering with garlic. I would award the label of best quality side to the Macaroni Cheese as this was a hefty side with well melted cheese and delightfully crispy crumbs on top (although if we are making comparisons its equivalent in Shackfuyu was a bit better as it had softer macaroni pasta); the Roast Field Mushrooms are also a welcome side to have - large and a good texture; and the sides of Creamed Spinach and Asparagus were just as their names suggest (nothing untoward there). Frankly my palate was not particularly impressed at this stage of the meal but luckily I could convince myself to consume more by way of dessert - for this dessert was unexpectedly incredible. I don't know if the fact that I had low expectations at this point accentuated the effect, but this dessert sure did give me a high. It was a peanut butter shortbread with salted caramel sauce and honeycomb ice cream. The shortbread and salted caramel was warm and fused together to achieve a lovely melting glory within your mouth, then balanced with the smooth cool and gently flavoured ice cream, altogether made for a masterpiece of a dessert. Despite having eaten more than my fair share of food, I found myself wondering if I should order another portion of this heavenly dessert; but I refrained for the sake of my bursting stomach. Courtesy of our chummy waiter we were treated to a Hawksmoor rolo each and my are these an explosion in your mouth - like a supremely rich and sweet chocolate and caramel bomb!In conclusion, if we're focusing on steak then from my experiences I preferred steak from Gaucho, Steak & Co. or even a local pub in Carshalton more than at Hawksmoor. In fact based on this (my first visit of Hawksmoor), on any next visit I would very much be tempted to have a couple of sides and skip the steak altogether, then just indulge in the dessert. This is certainly not the outcome I anticipated but the truth can come as a surprise sometimes.

Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Half lobster

wpM9GyiNoktNHOGp4cBulw.text: Outstanding cuisine and as importantly service - Vincent sommelier and rookie Joshua were over the top attentive and Vincent thank you for the Portugal vino tour!  My wife and I live in San Francisco and appreciate the good stuff.   Cheers

L0LUJGX_0WRfvCFyo6S9Gg.text: While in London recently, Diane and I had the pleasure of dining here with local resident Yee Gan O., my longtime Yelp friend.  The quality of the food and service by Marco enhanced the conversation and companionship.  And the setting was classy, as well.  We didn't know it yet, but Prince George was born on the day we were here.  So, for all in London on this date, it was a very special day.I began with Elberry Cove Mussels that had an excellent chili taste that tingled on the tongue.  Only one mussel of many arrived closed.My Filet Mignon was served medium rare as ordered, and was greatly enhanced by the sweet lobster meat of two tails and two claws dipped in Drawn Butter, a smooth Béarnaise Sauce, a mild but vibrant Peppercorn Sauce, and gravy-laced Beef Dipping Fries.  A Doddington Caesar Salad with anchovies and tasty bacon was quite good, and Creamed Spinach was clearly creamy.  Large Roasted Field Mushrooms were good as well, but I found a large piece of white shell mixed in with them.  Sweet Iced Tea was unusual tasting compared to that customarily served in the U.S., but still good.  Strawberry Ice Cream provided a good finish to a fine London dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Strawberry Ice Cream
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Lobster
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Filet Mignon

lO6ZyDPIKvL1ZJAbQpG6UQ.text: Seeing how hypen this place is through online and offline press, I expected more from this venue. The dull 70's like interior with brass panelled walls, turquoise details  and dark teak floors did make sense to my taste buds. The ambience was rather stark and pretentious. The food was just average with scampis for a starter in a very mellow white wine sauce. It needed a bit more for me. Perhaps an extra pinch of salt or more herbs. The presentation could have been better too. Overall I give credit to good service, excellent wine selection and convenient location. Just not my glass of champagne!

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. The zesty dessert at Hawksmoore in Air Street!
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Don't even remember what this drink was called but the fruit says it all

xgwR9V9KNsR-Pl6UVdvdWg.text: Eveyone raves about the potted beef and bacon Yorkshires.... Ours were burnt and no one seemed to care. Everything else was incredible. Was a shame that we started off on such a bad note.

fEw8qYCIRrKtqz1AXYq9qA.text: I've been to Hawksmoor many times before. After a bit of a break, a friend booked a table at the Air Street branch for dinner. This recent visit, was amazing, and one of the best meals I've had in recent memory, in big part down to the amazing waiter who served us. We ordered cocktails and a bottle of wine to start. However he suggested a different cocktail as the one I ordered was apparently much too filling and we'd have been unable to eat our steaks. He intuitively offered bread to a friend to dip in her mussel sauce. Not to mention my brixham crab on toast was mouth watering, with crab so fresh and the perfect amount of cream. My rib eye was also perfectly cooked. When my friend couldn't finish her steak, he packed it for her even though she didn't ask. At the end of the meal, the waiter brought us that cocktail I first ordered.. But on the house! Mind blown! You don't even always get such service at Michelin starred restaurants

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Brixham crab on toast

VI3BdvbMqrppGhynYgx_BQ.text: I'm sold!  This was my first time here and no only did I not have a reservation but everyone who we came across was very accommodating and hospitable.  I especially adored the servers who took such good care of us and even gave us a side dish on the house.  Most steakhouses can come across pretentious and stuffy, and although this is not exactly the budget restaurant for all, their kindness and humility was more than enough to capture my vote.  The wine selection was abundant and the food was phenomenal from the perfectly cooked porterhouse steak, to the tasty side dishes and finally the exquisite sticky toffee pudding.  Definitely will be back on my next trip to London.  See you folks soon!

Y7CuJ-1izPUs_jJBsb-PjA.text: I just looove the steak here! The starter has changed since the last time I visited. I had the beef/bacon with Yorkshire pudding. The steak was amazing! And the dessert was shortbread with peanut butter ice cream. Yummyyyy!

qn1ZGc6NnbpzLGcWKfh1qQ.text: The best steaks in the world, and this is not an exaggeration! Also the sides are delicious. Be prepared to eat your body weight in beef.

8yOkkagoA2ccLyEr0bGb1Q.text: Good to know this place is here, there's nothing flashy about this place at all. But once you enter you can feel the opulence. Its just a swanky place but kept simple. I came here for drinks and though I didn't partake in the boozy cocktails I did have a taste of some non-alcy drinks that were fun. can't remember them now.... i have a memory of a goldfish these days. i think I had the Pina colada but sans hooch and it was like a delicious coconut dessert. I had another one that I can't recall. But everyone around me enjoyed their drinks very much. out of a table of about 10 there were NO complaints. Coming from our group thats pretty much unheard of. Awesome place. Next time i'll have to try the food.

2IwYG9-0sbVm4OvrxlnzNw.text: My hotel concierge made this reservation for me while I was visiting London last month with friends. Steak are cooked to perfection. The menu is great the atmosphere is friendly and easy. The service rocks our waitress was excellent Five stars for everything. I can Waite to go back next month. Keep it going guys. Cheers to the whole staff and management.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Steak tartare a must order
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Ribeye perfectly cooked
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Lobster

Z6DAzZnn19CC617zVbwomA.text: My colleagues rave about Hawksmoor all the time and finally I was able to try it on this latest trip to London. They're not crazy about this- Hawksmoor was incredible. I can understand the buzz and why it was still difficult to get a reservation on a random Tuesday at the Air Street location.I love the Air Street area-this cool little place rammed in between Oxford and Piccadilly. There are pubs, a few high end restaurants and most importantly-a Whole Foods. While it's not that hidden-you do feel like you've just "discovered" this nook in the city every time you visit. Hawksmoor continues this feeling with their non descriptive facade and dark restaurant interior. You almost feel like you've been granted entrance into some sort of exclusive steak lover's club. Even on a Tuesday; the place was crowded and really lively-definitely my kind of scene. We were seated at the end of a banquette and got straight to ordering. Our server, who joking went by "Guacamole" had stellar recommendations for us and we followed them all. We did a little surf and turf with the lobster and Chateaubriand cut. They were both mouthwateringly tender and bursting with flavor. I had never had a Chateaubriand cut before and I can tell you that I'll be trying it again. For sides I would recommend the mushrooms (I would have eaten just these for dinner) mac and cheese and spinach with lemon and garlic. The mushrooms and the spinach paired really nicely with the light fattiness of the steak and the cream mac and cheese complimented the lobster quite well. We didn't save any room for dessert but our server pressed a box of salted caramel chocolates on us as we left. It was very sweet and they were very good. I now know where I'll be getting my steak in London from now on. Hawksmoor really wowed me and with their multiple locations they surely dominate the steakhouse scene in the city.

pT7kfiX6jD427N_xssw53g.text: Outstanding in every way. Literally one of the best meals ever. We love the old school steakhouse vibe and this was spot on for that. The waiters were phenomenal, made amazing recommendations and were incredibly kind- even when my husband spilled his drink all over the table. We started our meal with the beef carpaccio and oh goodness that was amazing. The I had the filet which was cooked and presented perfectly, and my husband loved his t-bone as well. The field mushrooms were a great side and if you go you must get the Mac and cheese! We have been in Europe for 10 days and this was by far our best meal. Add this to your must try restaurants for any occasion.

k5JUXiWRzjc_1iSxGpbaEQ.text: While visiting London I decided to have my bday dinner at this location. This was a wonderful meal. I had the sirloin with no bone with Mac n cheese and spinach. My meal was perfect! The steak was tender, flavorful and juicy. Our waitress Petra was so friendly and made great recommendations. She also sent us espresso martinis on the house, love that!! Make sure to make a reservation in advance and Uber there if you don't need to drive. I have no idea where to park.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom

oln36zLnij_dIShsClEyXw.text: Drinks great and food were just ok. The service on arrival from reception and coat check was very friendly and good.  Up the stairs to the bar, and again, good service - exactly what you would expect in a high end steakhouse.Into the dinning area we went, and that's where everything fell a little short.  Service from wait staff was really basic and didn't reflect the high standard that should be expected with their prices.  The food was good, but not outstanding.  It is a good place to have a meeting, but there are better places to have steak.

f1Ch1I6H2uFEXOmXekBNDQ.text: This place is where the Flinstones would just about die and go to heaven. This place is OOZING with originality, style and class. The meat is grade AAA and the flavors are raw and primal. Talk about perfect cuts of meat, grilled and broiled with flawless execution, more than tender to the bite. We loved this place and we'd go back, despite the expense. All the sides were out of this world too - especially the carrot mash.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom. Prime rib on the bone! For real dinosaurs!

MXh9xdOBANruKJAhLbz8jg.text: Very nice experience. Friendly waiter. Both crab toast and heirloom tomato toast very tasty. Rib eye steak very flavorful and well prepared. Triple fried chips great. Monk Fish just OK. Toffee pudding delicious. Pared meal with an excellent Bordeaux. All round lovely meal.

fUGDxfpWvu5uS8dYsPgmqQ.text: We came here for our old flatmate reunion - the interior design is really artsy, but you just can't shake the feeling that it is a super fancy Whetherspoons - which isn't actually a bad thing ;) The Sunday Roast is divine, and for £20 is amazing money for value. However, for the best Sunday Roast, the Hawksmoor in Covent Garden is the one!

-zsP4JafEjgLyTBs4Pww9w.text: I'm a huge Hawksmoor fan.  I need no excuse to eat at any of their restaurants and probably go almost one a month.Was staying in London for business and needed a late dinner.  Was not that far from Air Street so took a stroll along Piccadilly to see if they had any space.  Got a table for one without any issues and was sipping a gorgeous glass of Zinf within minutes.The food was great - but I'd expect nothing less from these guys.  Had a delicious and perfectly cooked Rib Eye, with Bone Marrow Gravy and Fries on the side.   I'm salivating just thinking about it !The service was spot on!  Nice and attentive, as well as friendly.  Considering was "billy no mates" for the night, all the staff were talkative and didn't make me feel awkward for being on my own.Whether you are a solo diner, or visiting with friends, colleagues or family, I would not hesitate in recommending Air Street!

CirY9Oo5_QSB7a5iZyGdYQ.text: Meat! That sums up the place.I thought it was alright, but my friends kept on saying how good their steak was so I'm going to believe them and give Hawksmoor a 5 star (not a big meat lover so I'm not the best to judge).Meat was perfectly cooked and super tender, the wine list is amazing (and the waiter recommendations were on point). Desert was fantastic though, I had a sticky toffee pudding and it was the best I've ever had. In my entire life. On the mac&cheese front I was a bit disappointed, creamy and cheesy but not very tasty (and way too much breadcrumbs.... seriously what's with the breadcrumbs, it's mac&CHEESE not mac&BREADCRUMBS).Pricewise it was super super super expensive (and add an other 2 super). Like I almost fainted when I saw the bill. But again my entire table was really happy with their meal so I guess it was worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hawksmoor - London, United Kingdom

OzZitQF1P5a2o_nsNUH_PA.text: I'm from the States, this is not up to par with American steakhouses. Not even close. We had the 1.2 kg prime rib and the porterhouse. Both cuts came out cold and dry. We ordered medium rare. The cuts were ok in the middle, but the ends were dry and over cooked. The paid over £100 for the prime rib and £80 for the porterhouse. If it was good, then it would be worth it, but considering it was not cooked correctly, it was overpriced. The quality of the meat is not great either. If you have a chance go to Peter Luger steakhouse in New York ( Brooklyn bridge). The service was good though.

QfTslGHfWtfFSUgcRgFtOw.text: Food:  My wife and I ordered the pre-set 2 course meal.  For the appetizer I got the Yorkshire pudding with bacon and I think some type of gravy.  That was pretty good.  For the main entree, I got the rump, which was good.  Food rating:  4/5Service:  Service here was good.  I had no idea how to eat the Yorkshire pudding since the gravy and the bacon came separately, so that was a fun learning experience.Service rating:  3.5/5Price:  For the set menu, expect to pay about $30Overall:  The food and service here is good.

j5ABrZcH3biBJ-3zO2ly5A.text: Very enjoyable experience. We had Sunday lunch here. The salads were great and the crab meat was so fresh and delicious. The fried scallops were ok, not great. The best part was the roast beef for 2! it only costed 20 pound. They gave you two plates of roast beef and they were very tender and tasty. The ambient is superb and elegant, very friendly waiter who was very very attentive. Bathroom was clean and spacious. It is a very upscale restaurant with reasonable prices. Great for family and first date. To impress your in laws, this venue will absolutely deliver!

NGXyi0xO3jlOyocFO76nBA.text: The food at the Hawksmoor was excellent.  I had a perfectly done fillet steak with a peppercorn sauce.  Very nice creamed spinach and potatoes.  The beer, wine and cocktail menu was equally good and quite extensive.  Central location and near the theatre district so an early dinner is possible.  Air Street is a small road off of Piccadilly so the restaurant is easy to miss.  The interior is quite large and is on the second floor with an very pleasant lounge at the top of the stairs.  I would love to give it more stars but regrettably the service was a bit off.  Our party arrive as they opened for dinner at 5 PM.  The restaurant was not busy but it took too long for our waitress to ask us if we wanted something something to drink.  We ordered drinks and dinner eventual only to find that before dinner arrived, a new waitress appeared with no explanation.  We also found out after we ordered a second Pilsner Beer that the brand we had ordered was something else.  Apparently, the first waitress had substituted another brand without telling us.  Not okay for any number of reasons!Perhaps the service issue was a fluke but I expected more from a high end steakhouse which touted its service and food.

ccnlto1bzk3jGEUyKZA_ng.text: Whomever evoked Great Gatsby as the atmosphere of this restaurant nailed it. It's very art deco.  If smoking were permitted indoors, I feel like everyone would have a cigar and brandy after dinner here.  My friend and I were on vacation to London, and chose this location of the Hawksmoor for our last night in town before heading on to Paris.  We were not disappointed. Starting out with a few great cocktails and some baked scallops, we each ate about half a cow, and I opted for the buttered greens as accompaniment to mine.  It was the perfect pairing with the juicy steak.  And as if all of that wasn't enough, I killed a sticky toffee sundae by myself.  Trust me, I paid for that dearly later when I woke up in the middle of the night with acid reflux, but it was worth it.  Service was excellent, and my only real complaint was hearing one of my fellow countrymen's voices carrying loudly over the rest of his table, and the entire dining room floor.  Small price to pay for one of the best meals I've had all year.

9VjyS81L3Xc1h929Wx_A6w.text: Love this place. I always visit when I'm in London. Amazing steak, cooked to perfection and DO NOT skip the dessert. The dessert is just amazing. Make a reservation, they r always full.

kjviaGtWqiJWEFSYAYCLRQ.text: This is a great steak house. We were able to get dinner reservations. We ordered rib eye to share and it was cooked per our request. Ordered side dishes of spinach with lemon and garlic, tomato salad, Caesar salad, creamed spinach. Everything was tasty. Service was just right.

kraMoSjLjP1pSfQdX-zaFQ.text: The seafood here is so good. The roast scallops taste good, fresh and tender. Similarly, the turbot fish is very good, tender and fresh. They definitely worth the price and 5 stars. I wish I could have more. For steaks, we tried the fillet. It's good, but it seems very ordinary compared to the seafood. This place is big so there are a lot of tables. The noise level is moderate and I like that it's not noisy. The environment in general looks very nice. The waitress has good recommendations for the food too.

hYGAsNdpwh36_2nkhT6yyg.text: Succulent steaks, well executed cocktails, trendy atmosphere, so-so seafood.  The friendly hostesses took my jacket and escorted me to the elegant bar upstairs. The cocktail menu, categorized by time of day, from right out of bed to cigars and poker, occupied me while waiting for my friend. London, so of course lots of gin. Pretty cool tab transfer to table via name on our reservation. Ready to eat, another pair of hostesses walked us into the dining room. Two of us were seated at a four top - nice elbow room.  Our personable server asked where we were from and explained the menu. The mussels we ordered as a starter were laughably small, but the sauce was delicious. Medium rare filet (British Beef) was mothwatering and tender.  Our sides, Mac & cheese and garlic spinach, were delicous, but hardly large enough to share. Our bone marrow ran late, so we weren't charged. Our server was very apologetic and professional.Ended with a scoop of blood orange sorbet, cleansing the pallet before walking off our meal.  159 GBP - not bad considering the quality of food and 5 drinks.

WE-uU5G1GXZY_xBuY-6OPQ.text: Firstly let's get to the point. Everything was great but the Steak....man the Steak was perfect. The best I've had in a while. You can tell they know their meat and you know why you pay the price for it. Only part of food I was a little disappointed with was triple cooked chips. Not piping hot not as crunchy on outside as I remember.The server was attentive and friendly with the meal great all the way through.One thing I must admit that disheartened me was upon ordering nearly 1kg of Porterhouse was that although I did ask my main server that I wanted to take bone away along with a few left over pieces of cut steak (and a little spinach I had left) was that another server (who randomly came in to ask if plates to be taken away 5 mins later - I know he was being efficient and courteous but those things confuse if not same server). I did tell him I wanted it all to be put in bag but when he came back only the pieces of steak were given back.In America everything is put in the bag. One- it's all the customers now (i was going to give my dog juicy fat porterhouse bone) and spinach was to with my steak but as no wastage either! That kind of saddened me actually. It didn't totally ruin my meal of course, but It did make the experience not as great as I had hoped. Even though me and my dad for fathers day had a great time. He did love his steak but we were miffed that not everything was presumed to be put in bag. l kept spinach behind on purpose too. Might be one for servers to at least ask customer first, or at least make it mandatory that everything is put in bag. The bone is actually a cool piece as it's not as if it's little worthless bone. It was something to marvel at when it arrived on table too. A talking point. I have conveyed this feedback to them also, and I'm sure they will take it on board.Will be back for sure. I think the Seven Dials or Spitalfields is still the best branches, just that last final bit of (service) of an expensive meal let it down for us. Still an awesome brand and kings of steak.

9OhnsLidTQBqpywypq9nYg.text: Great experience.   Bustling atmosphere with excellent service.    Started with muscles and scallops then moved into the roast beef for a wonderful birthday meal.   South African Shiraz topped things off for a great meal.    Highly recommend this spot.

eQI3Gz0CsVl0ksrdwNX2-A.text: We visited for Father's Day with our three year old for an early dinner and it didn't disappoint. Our son slept through the whole experience, meaning he was delightfully calm and silent (thank us later fellow customers for that achievement!), so we had a quiet meal. As a vegetarian I was worried going in but the food was outstanding. I had a fennel starter as a main on recommendation of the staff and it was delicious, but not on the online menus. Meanwhile, the father in the equation managed to see away a steak that clearly made up for my misgivings. The service and wine recommendations were some of the best I've had, especially when the place was so full on a special day. Would recommend absolutely!

lRlhUtHwocN-9QSJO_5cmQ.text: Food: 4.0/5.0Service: 3.5/5.0Value: 3.0/5.0Decor: 3.5/5.0Overall: 3.5/5.0Finally managed to find the time to stop by Hawksmoor on this trip.  This is a pretty decent steakhouse, and this is coming from a New Yorker.  The sides were very small though compared to American steakhouses (really only relevant for visitors from across the pond).  Prices were full but the food was good and generally worth it.

Z8ATlmv0wfN_WqESeJBgEw.text: A great location and small entrance does the not give justice to the actual scale of the resturant. I have been to the Knightsbridge branch and this is huge compared to this. You have a grand staircase and leading up to a great lateral space with two bars and ample space in an art deco style with stained glass windows. Next time will look to take more photos of the actual seating areas and bar. I added some notes to the booking and I was happy to see all my notes followed to a tee and this is attention to detail that I find impressive. You do have a bag and coat check area at the entrance by the way so do not worry if you arrive from a hectic day if shopping you will be relaxed and free of bags and jackets at the table. Just remember to collect on your way out! We ordered some Mock-tails with one specially made which at first we did not like and it was changed and altered as requested with no fuss. The food knowledge of the server was ok but not explained fully as I have experienced in the past so did not feel totally convinced with what we actually ordered. We were guided towards the Sunday Roast and a different cut of steak than we usually order as well as being cooked to a different degree so unfortunately we did not really rate the meat which is the main reason for coming but we will look to visit again and have what we usually have to see if that was just us being guided in the wrong direction for our taste and revert back with another review I hope in the future. Happy with the Sunday Roast gravy and Salad as well as the dessert. Service was good and always nice to see happy staff so cannot really fault staff attitude.  Dress Code: Anything although most people where smart and smart casual.  Ambience & Acoustics: This is where we hit a little bit of an issue like most large restaurants, during peak times you suffer from a lot of ambient noise so if you like this thats great but when you are looking to have a nice chat then I would recommend maybe taking a table by the bar area which seemed less busy so I would hope would be a better location to be seated if you want a nice conversation. Music however was not loud and just offering light background noise.  Drinks:  There was a couple of options for Mocktails and would be good to see more options offered to be honest. But the bar was happy to mix something up and even happy to change it when the first one did not come out right. We had the following:  Ribeye 400g - A large cut where you would struggle to eat the whole thing and not sure why you are not offered smaller cuts. I know from my last visit you are encouraged to share large cuts but when you both have different tastes I cant say this always works. Not a cut we are used to and not cooked the way we usually have so again not too impressed but will have to re-visit and have our usual and reserve comment.  Sunday Roast - A nice option with large portion size with large Yorkshire pudding with nice roast potatoes and veg, but the meat was hard work to cut and just average like a nice pub lunch but nothing special. The gravy however was special and really made the dish with a rich meaty flavour that really set off the Yorkshire pudding well as without this the Yorkshire pudding would have been too dry.  Triple cooked chips - It seems everyone now does triple cooked chips but not everyone does them well and nothing special here and although nice thick cut it was not as crispy or as fluffy inside as you would expect.  Doddington Caesar Salad - A light crispy really fresh salad that complimented the main really well and not over complicated but just perfect. Highly recommend this side.  Bone Marrow - Two large marrows served and cooked well and presented well.  Béarnaise Sauce - I am not really a fan of béarnaise so i cannot really comment.   Desert: Sticky Toffee Pudding - So far I would say this is the best in London and worth the visit just for this. Soft and moist and this was even after a large meal we still managed to finish this.  Bill / Cost: £108.00 for two Conclusion: Dessert is second to none and server even mentioned there is another dish even better, so we will have to come back. Not too impressed with the meat but having been steered to different cuts I think we need to re-visit with what we are used to in order to give a true comparison. Hence the lower mark this time which I hope on a re-visit this will go up. Another great thing to say is the restaurant itself also followed up via email on the visit and if we had any comments to which I responded and received a response, so I was able to share this review prior which is another nice touch as it is nice to see they care and not many if any actually take the effort these days and wait for reviews to be posted rather than being proactive, so this was nice to see.
